```{r libraries}
#included all the necessary libraries
library(tidyverse) 
library(moderndive)
library(skimr)
library(kableExtra)
library(gridExtra)
library(GGally)
library(infer)
library(broom)
library(ggfortify)
```



```{r data,echo=FALSE,eval=TRUE}
data<-read_csv("/home/suraj/Desktop/stats_folder/group_04.csv")#loaded the dataset
data$Household.Head.Sex <- as.factor(data$Household.Head.Sex) # modified sex variable to factor
data$Type.of.Household <- as.factor(data$Type.of.Household)# modified household var to factor

data$log.Income <- log(data$Total.Household.Income)#scaled down household income by taking log
data$log.food.ex <- log(data$Total.Food.Expenditure)#scaled down household income by taking log
data$sqrt.area <- sqrt(data$House.Floor.Area ) # scaled down house area by taking squareroot 

data <- data %>%
  select(-Region,-Total.Household.Income,-Total.Food.Expenditure,-House.Floor.Area)# remove unneccesary coloumns

```

# Formal Data Analysis {#sec:FDA}

we fit a poisson model as our response is a count variable. We have excluded Region as  a covariate because there was only one factor. 

```{r model1}
model1 <- glm(Total.Number.of.Family.members ~ log.Income +log.food.ex+Household.Head.Sex + Household.Head.Age + Type.of.Household +sqrt.area+House.Age+Number.of.bedrooms + Electricity  ,data = data,family = "poisson")  # fitted the poisson model using glm
get_regression_table(model1) %>%  # get regression tables using kable 
kable(caption = '\\label{tab:mod1} Estimates of the parameters from the fitted linear
model.') %>%
kable_styling(latex_options = 'HOLD_position') 

```
